headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, Deprecation, Sunset
headers.vary: Accept, Authorization, Cookie, X-GitHub-OTP, Accept-Encoding, Accept, X-Requested-With
headers.x-github-media-type: github.squirrel-girl-preview; format=json, github.inertia-preview; format=json, github.starfox-preview; format=json, github.mockingbird-preview; param=sailor-v-preview; format=json
headers.x-oauth-scopes: admin:enterprise, admin:gpg_key, admin:org, admin:org_hook, admin:public_key, admin:repo_hook, gist, repo, user, workflow, write:discussion, write:packages

data.title: Azure Policy as Code - Portal UI experience
data.body:
## Summary:

Azure Policy is one of the popular Azure service among top Azure customers. Nearly 300 out of top 300 Azure customers use it today. However, Azure Policy lacks features like history, traceability, safe deployment etc.  As a part of our solution, we intend to light up these capabilities for our customer. Azure policy as code effort spans across multiple Epics. 

### Problem statement:
 - As organizations continue the journey of governance with Azure Policy, the number of policies keeps increasing and quickly becomes unmanageable and customers have to depend on other systems for tracking changes.
- There is no standardized way for customers to 'copy' Azure policy to other collaboration or tracking systems.
  


### Features:
- [x]  #77 Azure portal policy UI changes and GitHub Authorization
- [x]  #76 Clone Azure policies to GitHub Repository
- [ ]  #477  Publish Nuget package to Azure feed




## EPD

Engineering: @ammohant 
Product:  @raiyanalam 
Design: N/A


## Partner Teams:
Engineering: Rohit B
Product: Liz K and Kemley N


## Related Documents:

1. [Azure Policy as code spec](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/ReleaseManagement/RM/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B592B97CA-EEC8-4427-A458-538294908209%7D&action=edit&source=https%3A%2F%2Fmicrosoft.sharepoint.com%2Fteams%2FReleaseManagement%2FRM%2FSitePages%2FHome.aspx%3FRootFolder%3D%252Fteams%252FReleaseManagement%252FRM%252FRM%2520Repository%252FTeam%2520Share%252FMd%2520Raiyan%2520Alam%252FAzure%2520Policy%26FolderCTID%3D0x012000EC92468EEA60CC4EAB8583F7EF2A8B6B%26View%3D%257B4D6F9EB5%252D24A1%252D4C72%252D9D08%252D6045BF34F0EA%257D&cid=53c4361f-10e3-45a3-b772-ebd3ec59a796)
2. [UI mocks](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:p:/t/Operations_Management_Suite/Edkgp7oUm3pDmKWnJzkkSz4BYLTpLw_X3ZnLvvOiZKZx7g)
3. [Customer Interview Questionnaire](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1egKFdGrTlaFsO2BIFPEqfQp3d-Pu_bBPH1_WxXIwlFU/edit#gid=0)


## Customer Connects:
#237 : Walmart
#238: MSIT Enterprise Health Team
#240: Equinor
#241: BP(British Petroleum)
#242: Avanade Inc
#243: Dept of Education, UK
#244: AT&T(MS Cloud formation team)
#245: C&AI Security Team
#246: Rackspace; Walgreens and Boots Alliance


## Success Criteria
OKR 2.2 GitHub repos deploying to Azure grows by 50%

N out of top 300 customers should use policy of code experience in the first 3 months.


## Checklist:
-  Assign this issue to yourself/individual
-  Add 'Epic' label to the issue
-  Link this Epic with Initiative
